channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Groups worry over safety of jailed peace consultants following Echanis slay
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: A support group for families and friends of political prisoners called on the government to tighten the security of jailed peace consultants, in the wake of peasant activist Randall Echanis’ murder on Monday.

item.title: Has pandemic response been recalibrated or is MECQ a repeat of the same policies?
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "I think the threat is going down. Yesterday we had 3,000 new cases, down from 6,000 previously. So I think we are ready to go down," Lorenzana said.

item.title: Palace: 'Delicate balancing' of health, economy needed if MECQ will be extended
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Doctors' groups had urged the government to impose the strictest lockdown scenario on four regions in Luzon for two weeks but officials said the government can no longer afford to do so because of its impact on the economy.

item.title: Guevarra hopes key PhilHealth officials under probe would go on leave
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra said he hopes “they would voluntarily go on leave while their agency is under intense investigation.”

item.title: Avigan trials on COVID-19 patients in Philippines to start on August 17
item.description: The Avigan tablets sent by Japan last week will be tested on 100 patients to determine the drug’s efficacy on treating the severe respiratory illness.

item.title: Filipinos injured in Beirut blast now at 47 — DFA
item.description: The Department of Foreign Affairs on Monday logged an additional five Filipinos who were injured by the deadly explosions in Lebanon's capital last week.

item.title: DOH: Rapid antibody tests not for screening COVID-19 cases but still useful
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Medical organizations have been sounding the alarm over the use of rapid antibody testing, saying results might create a false sense of security that may have contributed to the spread of COVID-19 in the Philippines.

item.title: Peace consultant, peasant activist Echanis killed in Quezon City
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Echanis, 72, was a long-time consultant for the National Democratic Front of the Philippines, and also sat as deputy secretary general of Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas.

item.title: PhilHeath chief reveals he filed for medical leave
item.description: The PhilHealth chief's condition was first publicized after he sent a medical certificate, dated August 7, to the Senate Committee of the Whole which stated that he was undergoing treatment for lymphoma and that he had been advised by his doctors to take a leave of absence.

item.title: Tropical Depression Ferdie exits PAR
item.description: PAGASA lifted all storm warning signals after the tropical depression left PAR.
